text: Glenn Victor Roeder (13 December 1955 â€“ 28 February 2021) was an English football manager and player. He was a player, Roeder represented England B on seven occasions. Roeder was a defender. He played club football for Leyton Orient, Queens Park Rangers, Notts County, Newcastle United, Watford and Gillingham. His managerial career included spells with Gillingham, Watford, West Ham United, Newcastle United and Norwich City. Roeder died on 28 February 2021 from brain cancer, aged 65. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Footballers from London Category:English football managers Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:Queens Park Rangers F.C. players Category:Watford F.C. players
title: Glenn Roeder
